title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Borthwickbrae (late member) had sent the form of an address, which was finished by Mr. Andrew Lang.'

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: died on the 2 2d of March, and the news seemed to act upon Scott exactly as the illness of Borthwickbrae had done in the August before.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: But, alas ! very soon after that address was accepted, Borthwickbrae (so Scott always called him, from his estate in the Forest) had a shock of paralysis as severe as any his old friend had as yet sustained.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: They, however,  preferred a shorter one from the pen of a plain practical country gentleman (the late Mr. Elliot Lockhart  of Borthwickbrae), who had often represented them in Parliament : and Sir Walter, it is probable, felt this disappointment more acutely than he has chosen to indicate  in his Journal.
